intro: Ranunculus multifidus, commonly known as the cutleaf buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, bright yellow flowers with deeply lobed, palmate leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
